file_content.text: I suppose I should expect you to do the impossible by now.
You Jedi never cease to amaze.
I'm guessing you've had some experience as a negotiator during your command.
Seems you're used to talking your way out of dangerous situations.
I sometimes forget that you Sith can get what you want without violence.
I'm not surprised that a bounty hunter has ties to criminal organizations, but I am surprised how you leveraged them.
I have to wonder if that was your plan all along. You certainly read that Houk like a book.
My predictions for that engagement ending in a peaceful resolution were negligible. I can't help but feel like it's delaying the inevitable.
It is, but Black Sun is a problem that we can afford to put aside.
Hard to stay focused on the objective when you have to worry about watching your own six.
It's possible we could be a good influence on some of them. It's an opportunity to do something with their lives.
That's the purpose of the legion. Except it's controlled--structured. Leaving that scum to their own devices puts a lot of people at risk.
I just convinced a band of street thugs to take on the premier superpower in the galaxy. I doubt I'm delaying anything.
Fair, but when the vermin scatter they'll be harder to root out.
It's moot now anyway. You made your call.
Eighty percent of my squads have successfully captured their objectives.
With their ringleader in our custody, any remnants will be too busy fighting among themselves to effectively regroup.
The death of their kingpin will be a crushing blow to their morale. Any holdouts are as likely to be fighting each other as my troops.
Black Sun's operation on Nar Shaddaa has been effectively neutralized.
So your mission here is complete?
I need to speak with command, but I can safely say that the campaign is concluding.
Thank you for allowing me to be part of this operation.
Master Jedi, it's always an honor to have you at my side.
You'd earned it.
I wouldn't puff yourself up too much for having overcome a glorified street gang.
I wouldn't claim that the legion is the match of a proper army yet, but the Black Sun Syndicate is nothing to scoff at.
The Supreme Chancellor is going to be pleased with the results.
I still have a lot to shore up before I withdraw the legion from Nar Shaddaa, but you'll hear from me soon.
I'll be in touch after things are shored up here. The legion will need a new objective and I'm willing to hear what you're after.
Thank you, Rusk.
It'll involve the Eternal Empire, that much you can count on.
Won't be a dull briefing then.
Just make sure this scum is ready for a fight.
They're always ready for a fight.
Glad to have you back, Master Jedi.
Rally up soon.
All preparations are made. Just waiting on you. Ready to pull the Black Sun's interests on Nar Shaddaa apart?
[Refuse Quest] Not yet.
Hup to, Dead Men! It's time to earn that free air you're breathing.
Thanks to you, I have units across Nar Shaddaa waiting to move on Black Sun's holdings.
The icing on the cake? We've learned where their kingpin runs the entire operation.
I see what the commotion is all about.
Final preparation is underway.
What do you plan to do with that information?
End this campaign in one fell swoop.
Finally. Put an end to this.
That's the plan.
I'm pulling together my strongest squads for a raid on the Black Sun headquarters. There's a spot for you, if you're interested--you've more than earned it.
Thank you, Rusk--I'd like to see this though.
I thought you might feel that way.
I could be. Tell me what we're up against.
I would rather have earned your cooperation in my fight against a more serious enemy.
We can talk about that once these gangsters are put in line. Working together here shows that we can work together elsewhere.
Even among criminals, Black Sun has a reputation for extreme brutality.
We don't know their numbers, but we can count on them being well-fortified and bloodthirsty.
Yes, I've had the pleasure of crossing paths with them before. Killers, kidnappers, and terrorists at best.
Not much different from the White Maw. We've handled worse.
Even their smuggling operations on Coruscant were unnecessarily sadistic. They stitched the contraband inside their couriers.
We found worse here.
I caught them dealing in nerve gas back on Coruscant.
I'll have my units ready their chemical weapons kits. I appreciate the heads-up.
I was once on the hit list of a guy called Rogun the Butcher. I can handle this.
I'm not going to ask.
The worst terrors they can imagine are pedestrian to a Sith such as me.
I'm sure I'll find their horseplay quite charming.
Don't remind me of the things you Imperials enjoy.
I've crossed paths with at least one of their kind before. "Brutal and sadistic" puts it lightly.
And that's why we've got to put them down.
My experience with the underworld is that their methods are often crude and sometimes effective.
This bunch seems to make up for it with enthusiasm.
I'm sure you and your troops are up to the task.
I've trained this lot into a respectable fighting force, and I'm sure a few have old scores to settle.
They're street thugs. This won't even be a challenge.
Never underestimate a cornered enemy.
We should be prepared to deploy any minute now. You ready?
Let's finish this.
Rally up, Dead Men! Operation Sunset is underway.
[Refuse Quest] I'll need to make preparations of my own.
You've got some time. But that intel we gathered will get stale before long.
We're close. I can feel it. We just need to find the weak link that'll bring it all down.
I have the names of several underbosses. Taking them into custody should speed things along.
We've identified some locations where the Black Sun does their business. We'll be raiding them soon. Maybe something will turn up.
The initial legwork is light on valuable targets, but we're learning what sectors Black Sun likes to terrorize.
Keep up the good work.
Stay the course.
I was hoping this would be finished sooner.
Wars aren't won in a day.
I have forces dispatched throughout Nar Shaddaa, but aside from rumors we've discovered little actionable intelligence.
[Requires Influence Level 10] Have you found your target yet?
[Deliver Intelligence] I found this on Black Sun members I encountered in the city.
These crooks don't seem to be big on record keeping, but their comm logs are proving useful.
These are helpful. They're all pieces to the bigger picture.
That should keep us on the right path at least. I'll look over it for clues.
[Give Contraband] I've brought something you should be able to bribe the locals with.
I can work with this. There's an information broker who'll always talk with the right incentives.
We've weeded out the liars from the reliable snitches. They're providing decent intel.
Much as I dislike it, these incentives have earned us some cooperation. You find any more, bring it my way.
I'll parcel it out carefully. Your contribution is appreciated. Don't let the troopers know you're collecting this stuff.
[Requires Underworld Influence Level 5] My contacts have turned up some useful information.
Your contacts are good. This will be a huge help.
I'll see what I can dig up myself.
Be careful out there. The members of Black Sun are as bad as they come.
Get your act together.
These scum know how to work the streets, I've just got to make sure they stay out of trouble.
Private Merghal, repeat subsection eight of article four-four-six of the Emergency Powers Act.
Pssh, like I read any of that.
You'll have plenty of time to in solitary confinement. You'll stay there until you can recite every regulation by heart.
Oh yeah?
Your next violation earns you a firing squad. Understand?
Okay, okay! I get you!
Report to Provost Decker for processing. Get out of here.
Stars, it's good to see your face. Sorry about the undignified welcome. They don't make leashes tight enough for this lot.
I'm glad to see you too. It seems like you've climbed the ranks since I've been gone.
There are very few people who would choose this command, but I'm honored to shoulder the burden for the good of the Republic.
I don't think I fully understand your situation here.
They look like rough customers. You must have your hands full.
Disciplinary actions account for thirty-two percent of my duties. But that number is dropping... these scum are wising up to how good they have it.
I'm disappointed, Rusk. I expected bigger things from you.
Someone has to do the dirty work. If I can give these sorry louts the opportunity to do one good thing for society, then it's worth it.
You just threatened that man's life. That's extreme, even for you.
Apologies, Master Jedi. I know your order's stance on the convict legion. Ugly truth of the matter is, most of them shouldn't be outside a brig.
I'm not here on behalf of the Jedi. Aygo wished for me to speak with the commander here.
Convict legion? All of these soldiers are prisoners?
Handle your soldiers as you please.
Justify it however you like. Threatening a subordinate with violence is appalling.
Not everyone can live up to the example of the Jedi. This lot can't even live up to "passable".
Wasn't expecting a visit or I would have spared you the messy welcome. I'd advise you not to mix with the troops here.
Aygo suggested I speak with the commanding officer here.
Why the warning?
That's a military police insignia. Since when do we forego a court-martial?
These men and women have already been sentenced. They're enjoying a stay because of their service to the war effort.
I'm not on official business, but if Fideltin Rusk is around I need to speak with him.
I don't approve of how you discipline your soldiers.
This isn't a unit of the Republic's finest.
Every trooper here has been condemned by the state for crimes that would make you retch. It's my duty to keep that in check.
But enough about me. Just what happened to you?
That's a conversation for another time. Right now, I need your help again. I'm gathering allies to strike against the Eternal Empire.
Straight to the heart of the problem. At least that hasn't changed.
I was held captive by Zakuul. I've been trapped in carbonite until recently.
In carbonite... or like before?
I've been in Wild Space, fighting against the Eternal Empire. Getting back was... difficult.
I feel like you're not telling me the whole story.
Master Jedi, I haven't forgotten the last time we failed to strike at the Emperor. You're sure that didn't happen again?
Truthfully, the Sith Emperor has been in my head. Arcann imprisoned us both.
That boy imprisoned you and the Emperor? Not so surprising that he managed to conquer the galaxy now.
I'm certain, Rusk. The rest is just details.
That's good enough for me.
You think I let the Emperor dominate me again?
I don't like to think that's possible, but you just vanished. Years without a word. It casts some doubt.
What can I do to help you again?
You've got soldiers. I could really use more troops in my Alliance.
Come with me, Rusk. I need your skills.
That would be my honor, Master Jedi, but I've been given this responsibility by the Republic.
If you're sniffing around for a place to hock contraband, I've got a strict zero-tolerance policy.
Aygo said I should get in touch with a Fideltin Rusk. He around?
Easy, now... apparently I don't want to get on your bad side. I'm looking for the person in charge.
You found him.
Care to explain why you were threatening that guy?
If you're some sort of protestor, take it up with your Senator.
Zero tolerance meaning "I shoot anyone I disagree with."
I have an outfit of hardened criminals that would like nothing more than to shoot me in the back. Zero tolerance means execution. For them, at least.
Hey buddy, I'm a Republic citizen--this "martial law" bunk isn't going to fly.
This area is off-limits to civilians. Period. I can promise that you don't want to be locked up with the people I have here.
Mind yourself, merc, or you might wind up in this outfit. Why are you trespassing in my headquarters?
I represent an alliance against the Eternal Empire. You the senior officer?
Another confederacy of misfits. Wonderful.
Looking for Fideltin Rusk. Where do I find him?
This is Republic sovereign territory per the Makeb treaty. Diplomatic envoys require proper authorization. Vacate immediately.
I'm not here on behalf of the Sith Empire. I command an alliance against Zakuul. Who's the senior officer?
That would be me.
Provost Marshal Fideltin Rusk, Dead Man's Legion. What's this about?
Aygo told me you might be receptive to lending your army to our cause.
Can you at least tell me how I can contact Fideltin Rusk?
It's Provost Marshal Fideltin Rusk, and you're speaking to him.
Aygo said I should find you. He's part of my alliance against the Eternal Empire.
This Dead Man's Legion sounded interesting to me. Like something I could use in the fight against Zakuul.
A joint operation? Interesting proposal, but it's not within my power.
A treaty will not save you from a Sith's anger.
I've seen action on every planet in your Empire. It's going to take more than threats to move me.
I respond poorly to threats.
I'm not going to repeat myself.
I'm only here because Aygo said you might be sympathetic to our cause: ending the Eternal Empire.
I heard he'd retired. You're telling me he's out with you and fighting Zakuul? That's a better use for a leader of his caliber, but it doesn't change the facts.
I need you to calm down. I am not your enemy. I'm searching for allies willing to fight Zakuul, not each other.
I admire your bravery, citizen, but you aren't talking to some mercenary outfit. The convict legion is a military unit.
It may not look it, but this is a military unit.
The Sith Empire hasn't been cooperative since Arcann invaded. About time that's changed, but I'm committed to this front.
Chancellor Madon has deployed the Dead Man's Legion to suppress a gang war for our Hutt allies.
I can't entertain any appeals to take my army elsewhere until we've mopped up here.
Perhaps I could speed that along?
That would boost operational efficiency considerably. The less time this lot spends on Nar Shaddaa, the better.
Sounds like politics to me.
The Hutts are claiming it's our responsibility, since the problem originated from Republic space.
Why is the Supreme Chancellor wasting troops on peacekeeping in Hutt Space?
This operation ensures the Hutt Cartel remains cooperative. The Republic doesn't need any more enemies right now.
Our objective is to root out fugitives of the Black Sun Syndicate that fled Coruscant and established themselves here. I need intelligence about their workings.
Any leads?
Aside from wandering the worst parts of town and shaking things up, we've got very little to go on.
To what end?
Find their ringleader and crush the whole problem at its core.
The Hutts should have provided that.
They've been obstinate, and a power play this brazen has them shaken. Most seem to be busy securing their own investments.
Getting our hands on information from Black Sun members themselves would be the most useful, but working underworld connections could be a force multiplier.
If all else fails, we may have to rely on securing illicit goods to grease some palms.
If that's all we have to go on, we'll have to make do.
No promises, but if I discover something I'll speak to you again.
This will continue to act as my base of operations until our campaign is complete. Bring anything you find here.
[Refuse Quest] Good luck with that. I don't plan to plumb the depths of this cesspit.
I'll be overseeing the search from here, Master Jedi. I hope to have better news next time we speak.
Then kindly move along.
Don't let your guard down. These soldiers are all hardened criminals.
[Smuggler Background] Definitely my area of expertise.
[Hand Over 1 Looted Intelligence]
[Hand over 1]
[Hand Over 5 Looted Intelligence]
[Hand over 5]
[Hand Over 1 crate of Illicit Goods]
[Hand over 1]
[Hand Over 5 crate of Illicit Goods]
[Hand over 5]
[Back]
